topic: How to combine winsound with typing for production code (Python 3.12+)
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to combine winsound with typing for production code (Python 3.12+)

response_parsed.title: Combining winsound and typing for Production-Ready Code in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This explainer demonstrates how to leverage winsound and typing libraries in Python 3.12+ for creating production-ready code that produces sounds with enhanced type hinting.
key_points: Use of `winsound` library to play system sounds
Integration of `typing` library for better type annotations
Demonstration of a custom class using these libraries
Example usage of the custom class in Python 3.12+ code

code_examples.code:
custom_sound = CustomSound()
custom_sound.play_sound('beep') # Plays a beep sound at 3 kHz for half a second

caveats: winsound may not be available on some platforms
The example provided uses a simple implementation for demonstration purposes
